wikipedia_page.main: Dr David Keith Chalmers MacDonald FRS FRSE FRSC  (24 July 1920 – 28 July 1963) was a 20th-century Scottish-born metal physicist, cryogenecist and scientific author. He was one of the founding fathers of modern cryogenics.  The MacDonald Memorial Lecture at the University of Manitoba is named in his honour. In authorship he is known as D. K. C. MacDonald, friends knew him as Keith MacDonald.
